intro: Aliciella sedifolia, commonly known as the leafy aliciella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Aliciella sedifolia is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its aromatic leaves have been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
